snippet: Toxic waste from factory farms is the leading cause of impaired water quality, but the federal government has failed to regulate the industry.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Environmental Protection Agency retreating from new regulations governing feedlot discharges, calling it latest development in agency's failure to protect waterways from factory farm runoff under Clean Water Act; calls on Gina McCarthy, Pres Obama's nominee to lead EPA, to begin forcefully regulating industry if she is confirmed by Senate.
lead_paragraph: Toxic waste from factory farms is the leading cause of impaired water quality, but the federal government has failed to regulate the industry.

headline.main: The E.P.A. Backs Off on Factory Farms
headline.print_headline: The E.P.A. Backs Off on Factory Farms
